title: scRegulocity: Detection of local RNA velocity patterns in embeddings of single-cell RNA-seq data
text: input scRegulocity consists aligned RNA-Seq reads normalized expression matrix. scRegulocity uses intron/exon read counts TSNE/UMAP/PCA embeddings identifying velocity-switching patterns, local patterns velocity nearby cells changes abruptly. 1. Generation intronic exonic read counts RNA-Seq BAM files: Intronic exonic read counts extracted directly mapped RNA-Seq reads. Step 2. Extract BAF values RNA-Seq bam files barcodes: 10x barcodes intrex_stats_ST.txt.gz: final output can download ANNOTATION_GFF_GZ_FP file : mouse human 2. Normalized gene expression data expression values can normalized using TPM FPKM raw. example normalized gene expression input : run generally takes 5-20 minutes.
code: gzip -cd ${ANNOTATION_GFF_GZ_FP} | grep -v "tag=PAR" | grep "gene_type=protein_coding;" | awk {'if($1!="chrY" && $1!="chrM" && $3=="exon")print $0'} > annotation_exons.gff IntrExtract -GENCODE_GTF_2_Interval_per_feature annotation_exons.gff exon gene_id regions.intervals IntrExtract -compute_single_cell_expression_stats_per_10X_SAM <barcodes> <bam_file> regions.intervals intrex_stats_ST.txt.gz

title: Detection of local RNA velocity patterns in embeddings of single-cell RNA-seq data
text: Generation intron exon read count statistics RNA-Seq BAM files: input scRegulocity consists bam file. first use c++ code, IntrExtract, extracting intron exon read count statistics bam file. Intron exon read count statistics extracted directly mapped RNA-Seq reads using algorithm called IntrExtract. can download IntrExtract C++ source binary code . downloading source code type following: executable located directory /bin. IntrExtract output files read using following functions: emb: contains reduced dimension projection (PCA/tSNE/UMAP) coordinates cells. Creating scRegulocity object scRegulocity object required performing velocity analysis single-cell data. scRegulocity object created using following functions motif_ref: file can downloaded Running scRegulocity object creating scRegulocity object perform analysis using function: extract regulotory network using velocity changes using function:
code: cd IntrExtract make clean make intex_stats <- readIntrexStats (file.dir="./intrex_stats_ST.txt/", file.name="intrex_stats_ST.txt", emb=emb)  stats <- normalizeAndSmoothIntrexStats (emat=intex_stats$emat, nmat=intex_stats$nmat, smat=intex_stats$smat) motif_ref <- "hg19-tss-centered-10kb-7species.mc9nr.feather"  scRegulo_obj <- CreateSCReguloCityObject(emat = stats$emat, nmat = stats$nmat, smat =NULL,  emb=intex_stats$emb,  species="mouse" , motif_ref=motif_ref, cell.types=cell.types) scRegulo_obj@vel<- scRegulo_obj@vel[which(apply(scRegulo_obj@vel, 1, sd)>1), ] kNNdistplot(scRegulo_obj@emb[, 1:2], k = 20) neigh <- 6  scRegulo<- applyReguloCity  (object=scRegulo_obj, neigh=neigh, minsize=10) scReguloTF <- extractRegulatoryNetwork (object=scRegulo,  minNumGenesInPattern=5, motifAnnotations=motifAnnotations)
